remarks: Choice-free analogue of ~ iblmulc2 .  (Contributed by Brendan Leahy, 17-Nov-2017.)
statement:
itgmulc2nc.1 $e |- ( ph -> C e. CC ) $.
itgmulc2nc.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> B e. V ) $.
itgmulc2nc.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. A |-> B ) e. L^1 ) $.
itgmulc2nc.m $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. A |-> ( C x. B ) ) e. MblFn ) $.
iblmulc2nc $p |- ( ph -> ( x e. A |-> ( C x. B ) ) e. L^1 ) $.
$d A x $.
$d C x $.
$d V x $.
$d ph x $.
